title: Blue Jeans
content:
I do not have any sample of this font, but I remember that I sometimes used to use a font called "Blue Jeans" at my previous work place. If I remember correctly, it is a Type1 font, but I am not 100% on that one.

So, if anyone has any information at all about "Blue Jeans" (foundry / who made it / where can it be bought), then I would appreciate hearing it. I haven't been able to even come up with anything proofing this font's existance through google, although I remember using it for several DVD covers.

Information that I remember:  
- Blue Jeans (100% sure about name)  
- It is a trashy font. We found it suitable on the covers for horror movies and such.

Thanks in advance,  
Johan
author: aia

comments.content: I have a font called _Blue Jeans 8_ but it’s not trashy at all. It’s a knock off of Revue.
Blue Century by T-26 is kinda trashy...

The "Blue Jeans" that I am thinking of is that font that Sander de Voogt linked to.

Thank you all for the help!
